org.apache.hama.commons.math

Class DenseDoubleMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hama.commons.math.DenseDoubleMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DoubleMatrix

    public final class DenseDoubleMatrix
extends Object
implements DoubleMatrix
    Dense double matrix implementation, internally uses two dimensional double arrays.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double[][] matrix 
      protected int numColumns 
      protected int numRows

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DenseDoubleMatrix() 
      DenseDoubleMatrix(DenseDoubleVector first)
      Sets the first column of this matrix to the given vector.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(DenseDoubleVector first, DoubleMatrix otherMatrix)
      Creates a new matrix with the given vector into the first column and the other matrix to the other columns.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(double[][] otherMatrix)
      Simple copy constructor, but does only bend the reference to this instance.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(double[] v, int rows, int columns)
      Copies the given double array v into the first row of this matrix, and creates this with the number of given rows and columns.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(DoubleVector[] vectorArray)
      Generates a matrix out of an vector array.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new empty matrix from the rows and columns.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns, double defaultValue)
      Creates a new empty matrix from the rows and columns filled with the given default value.
      DenseDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns, Random rand)
      Creates a new empty matrix from the rows and columns filled with the given random values.

      Apply a double function f(x) onto each element of the matrix.

      Apply a double double function f(x, y) onto each pair of the current matrix elements and given matrix.

      Returns an array of column indices existing in this matrix.

      Deep copies the given matrix into a new returned one.

      Divides this matrix by the given other matrix.

      Get a single row of the matrix as a vector.

      Get the matrix as 2-dimensional double array (first dimension is the row, second the column) to faster access the values.

      Returns the maximum value of the given column.

        columns - the num of columns.

                 int columns,
                 double defaultValue)

        columns - the num of columns.
        defaultValue - the default value.

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(int rows,
                 int columns,
                 Random rand)
        Creates a new empty matrix from the rows and columns filled with the given random values.
        Parameters:
        rows - the num of rows.
        columns - the num of columns.
        rand - the random instance to use.

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(double[][] otherMatrix)
        Simple copy constructor, but does only bend the reference to this instance.
        Parameters:
        otherMatrix - the other matrix.

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(DoubleVector[] vectorArray)
        Generates a matrix out of an vector array. it treats the array entries as rows and the vector itself contains the values of the columns.
        Parameters:
        vectorArray - the array of vectors.

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(DenseDoubleVector first)
        Sets the first column of this matrix to the given vector.
        Parameters:
        first - the new first column of the given vector

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(double[] v,
                 int rows,
                 int columns)
        Copies the given double array v into the first row of this matrix, and creates this with the number of given rows and columns.
        Parameters:
        v - the values to put into the first row.
        rows - the number of rows.
        columns - the number of columns.

      • DenseDoubleMatrix

        public DenseDoubleMatrix(DenseDoubleVector first,
                 DoubleMatrix otherMatrix)
        Creates a new matrix with the given vector into the first column and the other matrix to the other columns.
        Parameters:
        first - the new first column.
        otherMatrix - the other matrix to set on from the second column.

      • splitLastColumn

        public final Tuple<DenseDoubleMatrix,DenseDoubleVector> splitLastColumn()
        Splits the last column from this matrix. Usually used to get a prediction column from some machine learning problem.
        Returns:
        a tuple of a new sliced matrix and a vector which was the last column.

      • splitRandomMatrices

        public final Tuple<DenseDoubleMatrix,DenseDoubleMatrix> splitRandomMatrices(float percentage)
        Creates two matrices out of this by the given percentage. It uses a random function to determine which rows should belong to the matrix including the given percentage amount of rows.
        Parameters:
        percentage - A float value between 0.0f and 1.0f
        Returns:
        A tuple which includes two matrices, the first contains the percentage of the rows from the original matrix (rows are chosen randomly) and the second one contains all other rows.

      • multiplyTransposedVectors

        public static DenseDoubleMatrix multiplyTransposedVectors(DoubleVector transposed,
                                          DoubleVector normal)
        Some strange function I found in octave but I don't know what it was named. It does however multiply the elements from the transposed vector and the normal vector and sets it into the according indices of a new constructed matrix.

      • error

        public static double error(DenseDoubleMatrix a,
           DenseDoubleMatrix b)
        Just a absolute error function.

      • applyToElements

        public DoubleMatrix applyToElements(DoubleFunction fun)
        Description copied from interface: DoubleMatrix
        Apply a double function f(x) onto each element of the matrix. After applying, each element of the current matrix will be changed from x to f(x).
        Specified by:
        applyToElements in interface DoubleMatrix
        Parameters:
        fun - The function.
        Returns:
        The matrix itself, supply for chain operation.

      • applyToElements

        public DoubleMatrix applyToElements(DoubleMatrix other,
                           DoubleDoubleFunction fun)
        Description copied from interface: DoubleMatrix
        Apply a double double function f(x, y) onto each pair of the current matrix elements and given matrix. After applying, each element of the current matrix will be changed from x to f(x, y).
        Specified by:
        applyToElements in interface DoubleMatrix
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix contributing the second argument of the function.
        fun - The function that takes two arguments.
        Returns:
        The matrix itself, supply for chain operation.
